intro: Heterotheca chihuahuana, commonly known as the Chihuahua coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the Chihuahuan Desert in North America. It is characterized by its showy yellow flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Heterotheca chihuahuana is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
